reviews.review_msg:
there wasnt an option for esr100 so i selected wtv
she's one of the nicest and most helpful profs i've ever met. she's very passionate about what she's teaching. just make sure to complete the weekly assignments and participate in class its an easy A from there

Very specific with instructions, but is more chill in person than on paper (criteria, syllabus, etc.). She lowers the total points of each exam to raise people's grades. Make flashcards during lectures. Try to do both tb readings and lecture content review. Use critical thinking during exams b/c they may have questions you've never seen before.

Chill prof
Yes, you'll probably want to attend the classes to scoop up a participation grade.
Just keep up with her slides weekly and you'll be fine (as you can tell I didn't).
There are also weekly assignments which can be a bit of a pain but it's good practice.
Group projects are unnecessary imo but they do exist and there's 2 of them.
Notes are poorly organized, exams are too hard, and lecture is extremely boring
Lectures are very boring, waaaay too much reading from the textbook, lectures dont line up with exams, she lectures information right before each exam (day of) that isnt on the exam
Super easy class. Material is very interesting as well. Her powerpoints related directly to the text, however I recommend reading the textbook as well.
best prof ever, study and go to lecture and it will be a breeze. super nice and helpful too
def a gpa booster. go take it with her
easy A class as long as you keep up the reading. lecture notes is easy very clear and easy to read.

She really does care for students. When her tests were confusing she gave marks for the questions that was not clear after the exam and she is welcoming when you go to her office hours and really seem to have a passion for languages.  Her exams needed thinking but I think that it's because the topics overlap I don't think it was actually that hard
